text:
I get a "cannot instantiate 
com.sun.jndi.rmi.registry.RegistryContextFactory ;root exception is 
ClassCastException when I try to create an Initial Context using
java.naming.factory.initial : com.sun.jndi.rmi.registry.RegistryContextFactory.
I've tried also with 
java.naming.factory.initial 
org.objectweb.jeremie.libs.services.registry.jndi.JRMIInitialContextFactory
getting the same exception.
Did I miss something or this is a bug?...I had no problem in doing that with 
Tomcat 3.2.1.
creator: dcernahoschi@softwin.ro
remm@apache.org
text:
With JDK 1.3, when loading a JNDI implementation from the system classpath, a 
class conflict would occur when using one of the JNDI implementations included 
in the JDK. Now, bin/jndi.jar won't be added to Catalina's classloader if the 
JNDI classes can be loaded from the system classpath.
